data.title: Sticky Selection
data.body:
Refine micro mechanics. Allow for more organic feeling controls.

This mechanic is very helpful for a number of micro techniques, such as:

Splitting.
Concaves.
And Kiting.

Mechanics that allow for players to show off their skill in unit control
makes a more exciting to watch and more rewarding to play game without raising the skill floor.

Video showcasing the change in work:

http://www.mediafire.com/watch/dj9i9bba4r4inbt/OpenRA.Game_2015-05-17_03-20-27-896.avi

data.title: Load textures using premultiplied alpha.
data.body:
There is a bunch of literature online about why premultiplied alpha is a good thing, so I won't repeat it here.  It also lets us simplify and improve our world sprite blend modes.

Improved harvester animation:
![harv](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/7667377/08a4c972-fbfd-11e4-8005-86055bfa9610.png)

Improved Deviator gas (same panel order as above):
![deviator](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/7668114/df9abba0-fc1e-11e4-83c7-6bc7f315af1d.png)

In the premultiplied color space additive blend mode is the same as the alpha blend mode with Alpha: 0 and Premultiply: false.  You can create various soft mixed blends by setting Alpha part way between 0 and 1.

Fixes #8168.

data.body:
When loading a map created by the old editor, or an imported one:

```

```

data.title: Certain Infantry Death Sounds Cause Crash
data.body:
While playing skirmish with the *.MIX files from the DOS version of Command & Conquer, sometimes, when an infantry unit dies the game crashes.  Have reproduced once under similar conditions.

```
Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version release-20150424
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.AudLoader.LoadSound(Stream s)
   at OpenRA.Sound.LoadSound(String filename)
   at OpenRA.Primitives.Cache`2.get_Item(T key)
   at OpenRA.Sound.PlayPredefined(Ruleset ruleset, Player p, Actor voicedUnit, String type, String definition, String variant, Boolean relative, WPos pos, Single volumeModifier, Boolean attenuateVolume)
   at OpenRA.Sound.PlayVoiceLocal(String phrase, Actor voicedUnit, String variant, WPos pos, Single volume)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.DeathSounds.Killed(Actor self, AttackInfo e)
   at OpenRA.Traits.Health.InflictDamage(Actor self, Actor attacker, Int32 damage, DamageWarhead warhead, Boolean ignoreModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Traits.HealthExts.InflictDamage(Actor self, Actor attacker, Int32 damage, DamageWarhead warhead)
   at OpenRA.GameRules.DamageWarhead.DoImpact(Actor victim, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Warheads.SpreadDamageWarhead.DoImpact(WPos pos, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.GameRules.DamageWarhead.DoImpact(Target target, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo.<>c__DisplayClassc.<Impact>b__8()
   at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo.Impact(Target target, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects.Bullet.Explode(World world)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects.Bullet.Tick(World world)
   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>b__11(IEffect e)
   at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

- Nearly every third Build (PR) fails becaus of something what isnt supported on this named CI doesnt do its job right
- What about Jenkins X.x ?! 
- Or we disable Appveyor for bleed (what sense has Appveyor on Bleed?) When we package some things for Windows at release time it would be nice but doesnt help us all the time =(

Ideas how to fix that CI problems?

data.title: Introduce WithFacingSpriteBody and related With*Animation traits
data.body:
Another (large) step towards getting rid of `RenderSimple` and all traits based on it, and instead use `RenderSprites` + `WithSpriteBody`-based traits and additional `With*Animation` traits.

This PR modifies `WithSpriteBody` to be roughly equivalent to `RenderSimple` and introduces `WithFacingSpriteBody` for moving actors with facings, as well as 
1) `WithMoveAnimation` to replace `RenderUnitFlying` special cases and 
2) `WithAttackAnimation` to replace `RenderUnitReload` special case as well as allow the use of `WithFacingSpriteBody` in cases where `WithInfantryBody` would be overkill (example: TS Wolverine Mech).

This should fix the issue with the Wolverine occasionally getting stuck on the last shooting frame as a side-effect.

Once DeployToUpgrade lands, we can probably use this to implement TS deployable units better since With*Body is upgradable.

data.title: TFD Installer for Tiberian dawn, Red Alert and Tiberian Sun
data.body: Installs Tiberian dawn from the The First Decade Disk. Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3863.

data.title: Leaving game in spectator breaks replays
data.body: When a player that is spectating leaves a current sessioned game the replays stops at that point. This happens in TD. The game itself will continue on just fine however. But the replay stops at that exact point when a player leaves spectator.

data.title: Reconsider the rendering blend modes.
data.body:
#7979 introduced a transluency parameter for all blend modes, but did not remove the dedicated `Transluency` mode.  This is a) a design smell, and b) potentially confusing ("what's the difference between normal blending with translucency, and translucent blending with translucency" asks the openra modder).

Our blend mode selection needs to be reconsidered in light of this new behaviour, and have their channel blending set up in a way that makes sense with and without translucency.

data.title: Prevents satellite icons from being drawn over frozen actors.
data.body:
Fixes #7920. Steps to test if this patch works:
Build satellite, move a unit next to an enemy building that is shown as satellite icon. Move away from the building so that its frozen fog image is rendered for the first time. Watch the building closely right when it becomes frozen under fog. Before this patch -> satellite icon is shown for a fraction of a second. After this patch -> no satellite icon is shown over frozen image.

data.title: Changes faction name from England to Britain so that it matches the flag
data.body:
Second attempt at fixing #8024. Changing flag to match name was rejected so I changed name to match flag. I changed all occurances of "england" I could find except for the one here: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/89a1bdd4f15d7a960a9ece1e89181b440a839705/OpenRA.Mods.Common/UtilityCommands/LegacyMapImporter.cs#L460

I didn't know if that would need to be changed.

data.title: 3rd-party mod dlls need custom config on Windows systems with older .NET
data.body:
On Windows machines which don't have .NET versions newer than 4.0 installed, a custom OpenRA.Game.exe.config with this content is needed to avoid a `SystemNotSupportedException` with custom, directly downloaded 3rd-party mod DLLs:

http://www.codeitive.com/0HmeqUeeVq/c-configure-loadfromremotesources-through-code-not-appconfig.html

data.title: Corrects England's flag.
data.body: Fixes #8024.

data.title: Added lint rules to detect bad spawn points in maps.
data.body: This will detect faulty maps with invalid spawn points (they can't share the same location for obvious reasons) such as those described in #8115 and show a FIXME warning as well as disable download at resource.openra.net. Another rule will detect maps where the Multi\* player definitions don't match the spawn point count. This happens when you forgot to click "Setup default players" in the OpenRA.Editor.exe which is a common pitfall. Only the not enough spawn points case is really problematic though.

data.title: AppVeyor Windows build significantly slower than Mono build running on Microsoft Windows
data.body:
My numbers on Win7x64, i5-2500 CPU, RA shellmap:

OSX release 20150424: avg ~4.0-4.5 Tick / ~2.5-3.0 Render
Win release 20150424: avg ~5.5-6.0 Tick / ~4.0-4.5 Render

So the mono build is at least roughly 30-50% faster with identical compile settings (Debug mode, no optimization).

data.title: Ingame Map Editor : delete a tile with right-click
data.body:
Could it be possible to delete a tile with a simple right click ? (It's already possible to remove actors this way, why not tiles too?). It would be really handy.

As @Phrohdoh suggested on IRC : "It would just paint a Clear0x tile."

In fact (imo), to work properly, this feature would have to:
- detect which tileset is currently used
- detect the surrounding tiles (for example: water tiles)
- paint a random Terrain/Basic/Clear tile depending on where the cursor is (over grass or over water)

data.title: ArmorDrop has been removed
data.body: ... so let's remove it from the AI.

data.title: Add faction description tooltips to TD
data.body: Closes  #6288.

data.title: Automatized GeoIP database download
data.body: I always forget to update this one before releases and it is a binary that should not be stored here. According to http://dev.maxmind.com/geoip/geoip2/geolite2/ it is updated every first Tuesday of the month. I need some help with PowerShell to update the AppVeyor cache. The rule can probably be simplified to just "every Tuesday" or maybe even better some other day of the month to not stress the Maxmind servers when everybody runs his update. It does not need to be bleeding edge, but still update every once in a while.
